title: Geth keeps crashing in full or fast mode after adding keystore files
body:
Hi there,

8cores 16gb Ram 400gb SSD newest Ubuntu 18
Geth version: `newest master branch`
OS & Version: Ubuntu 18

#### Expected behaviour
After Adding keystore files it shouldn't crash

#### Actual behaviour
crashes after 20-35minutes

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
add keystore files to the keystore folder and start geth:
geth --syncmode "fast" --rpc --rpcaddr 173.212.220.23 --rpcport 8555 --rpcapi="eth,net,web3,personal,txpool" --maxpeers 80 --cache 12000

@Bitbladesupport you are getting a `fatal error: runtime: out of memory`, because you are running out of memory. For 16GB of RAM, the value of `--cache` is too high. I think `geth` is supposed to use ~ 2 * `--cache` (don't quote me on that), so I suggest you reduce it to 4096 for example, and if you really want it to be higher - gradually increase from there on.
@Bitbladesupport does the problem persist or did lowering the cache setting solve it?

This issue has been automatically closed because there has been no response to our request for more information from the original author. With only the information that is currently in the issue, we don't have enough information to take action. Please reach out if you have more relevant information or answers to our questions so that we can investigate further.
